title: Relates to active self-insurers
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2818

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   February 2, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. MAZIARZ -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Labor

       AN ACT to amend the workers' compensation law,  in  relation  to  active
         self-insurers

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The opening paragraph of subparagraph 4 of paragraph (h) of
    2  subdivision 8 of section 15 of the workers' compensation law, as amended
    3  by section 1 of part QQ of chapter 56 of the laws of 2009, is amended to
    4  read as follows:
    5    As soon as practicable after May first in the  year  nineteen  hundred
    6  fifty-eight,  and annually thereafter as soon as practicable after Janu-
    7  ary first in each succeeding year, the chair of the board  shall  assess
    8  upon and collect from all self-insurers, except group self-insurers, the
    9  state  insurance fund, all insurance carriers and ALL ACTIVE group self-
   10  insurers, (A) a sum equal to one hundred fifty per centum of  the  total
   11  disbursements made from the special disability fund during the preceding
   12  calendar year (not including any disbursements made on account of antic-
   13  ipated  liabilities  or  waiver  agreements  funded by bond proceeds and
   14  related earnings), less the amount of the net assets in such fund as  of
   15  December  thirty-first  of  said  preceding calendar year, and (B) a sum
   16  sufficient to cover  debt  service,  and  associated  costs  (the  "debt
   17  service assessment") to be paid during the calendar year by the dormito-
   18  ry authority, as calculated in accordance with subparagraph five of this
   19  paragraph.  Such  assessments  shall  be  allocated to (i) self-insurers
   20  except group self-insurers and the state insurance fund based  upon  the
   21  proportion  that the total compensation payments made by all self-insur-
   22  ers except group self-insurers and the state insurance fund bore to  the
   23  total compensation payments made by all self-insurers except group self-
   24  insurers,  the  state  insurance  fund,  all  insurance carriers and ALL
   25  ACTIVE group self-insurers,  (ii)  insurance  carriers  based  upon  the

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD08163-01-1

       S. 2818                             2

    1  proportion  that  the  total compensation payments made by all insurance
    2  carriers bore to the total compensation payments  by  all  self-insurers
    3  except  group  self-insurers, the state insurance fund and all insurance
    4  carriers and ALL ACTIVE group self-insurers during the fiscal year which
    5  ended  within  said  preceding calendar year, and (iii) ALL ACTIVE group
    6  self-insurers based upon the  proportion  that  the  total  compensation
    7  payments  made  by  all  ACTIVE  group  self-insurers  bore to the total
    8  compensation payments made by all self-insurers (EXCEPT  INACTIVE  GROUP
    9  SELF-INSURERS),  the  state  insurance  fund  and all insurance carriers
   10  during the fiscal year which ended within said preceding calendar  year.
   11  Insurance  carriers  [and], self-insurers AND ACTIVE GROUP SELF-INSURERS
   12  shall be liable for all such assessments regardless of the date on which
   13  they came into existence, or  whether  they  have  made  any  claim  for
   14  reimbursement  from the special disability fund. The portion of such sum
   15  allocated to self-insurers except  group  self-insurers  and  the  state
   16  insurance  fund  that shall be collected from each self-insurer except a
   17  group self-insurer and the state insurance fund shall be a sum equal  to
   18  the  proportion  of  the amount which the total compensation payments of
   19  each such self-insurer except a group self-insurer or the  state  insur-
   20  ance  fund  bore to the total compensation payments made by all self-in-
   21  surers except group self-insurers and the state  insurance  fund  during
   22  the  fiscal  year  which  ended within said preceding calendar year. The
   23  portion of such sum  allocated  to  insurance  carriers  that  shall  be
   24  collected  from  each  insurance  carrier  shall  be a sum equal to that
   25  proportion of the amount which the total standard premium by  each  such
   26  insurance  carrier  bore  to  the total standard premium reported by all
   27  insurance carriers during the calendar  year  which  ended  within  said
   28  preceding fiscal year. The portion of such sum allocated to ACTIVE group
   29  self-insurers that shall be collected from each ACTIVE GROUP self-insur-
   30  er  shall be a sum equal to that proportion of the amount which the pure
   31  premium calculation for each such ACTIVE group self-insurer bore to  the
   32  total  pure  premium  calculation for all ACTIVE group self-insurers for
   33  the calendar year which ended within the preceding  state  fiscal  year.
   34  The  payments  from  the  debt  service assessment, unless otherwise set
   35  forth in the special disability fund  financing  agreement,  are  hereby
   36  pledged  therefor  and  shall  be  deemed  the  first monies received on
   37  account of assessments in each year. For the purposes of this paragraph,
   38  "standard premium" shall mean the premium as defined for the purposes of
   39  this assessment by the superintendent of insurance, in consultation with
   40  the chair of the board and the workers' compensation rating  board.  For
   41  purposes of this paragraph "pure premium calculation" means the New York
   42  state  annual  payroll as of December thirty-first of the preceding year
   43  by class code for each employer member of [a] AN ACTIVE  group  self-in-
   44  surer  multiplied  by  the  applicable  loss cost for each class code as
   45  determined by the workers' compensation rating board in effect on Decem-
   46  ber thirty-first of the preceding year, and for [a group or] AN individ-
   47  ual self-insurer who has ceased to self-insure shall be based on payroll
   48  at the time the group or individual self-insurer ceased  to  self-insure
   49  reduced  by a factor reflecting the reduction in the [group or] individ-
   50  ual self-insurer's self-insurance liabilities since ceasing to  self-in-
   51  sure.  An  INDIVIDUAL employer who has ceased to be a self-insurer [or a
   52  group that ceases to be licensed as a group self-insurer] shall continue
   53  to be liable for any assessments  into  said  fund  on  account  of  any
   54  compensation  payments  made  by him or her on his or her account during
   55  such fiscal year, and the security fund, created under the provisions of
   56  section one hundred seven of this chapter, shall, in the  event  of  the

       S. 2818                             3

    1  insolvency  of any insurance company, be liable for any assessments that
    2  would have been made against such company except for its insolvency.  No
    3  assessment shall be payable from the aggregate trust fund, created under
    4  the  provisions  of  section twenty-seven of this article, but such fund
    5  shall continue to be liable for all compensation that shall  be  payable
    6  under  any  award or order of the board, the commuted value of which has
    7  been paid into such fund.  Such  assessments  when  collected  shall  be
    8  deposited  with the commissioner of taxation and finance for the benefit
    9  of such fund. Unless otherwise provided,  such  assessments,  shall  not
   10  constitute  an element of loss for the purpose of establishing rates for
   11  compensation insurance but shall for the purpose of collection be treat-
   12  ed as separate costs by carriers. All insurance carriers and  the  state
   13  insurance fund, shall collect such assessments, from their policyholders
   14  through a surcharge based on premiums in accordance with rules set forth
   15  by  the  superintendent  of  insurance in consultation with the New York
   16  workers' compensation rating board and the  chair  of  the  board.  Such
   17  surcharge shall be considered as part of premium for purposes prescribed
   18  by  law  including, but not limited to, computing premium tax, reporting
   19  to the superintendent of insurance pursuant to  section  ninety-nine  of
   20  this  chapter  and  section  three  hundred  seven of the insurance law,
   21  determining the limitation of expenditures for the administration of the
   22  state insurance fund pursuant to section eighty-eight  of  this  chapter
   23  and the cancellation by an insurance carrier, including the state insur-
   24  ance  fund,  of  a  policy for non-payment of premium. The provisions of
   25  this paragraph shall not  apply  with  respect  to  policies  containing
   26  coverage  pursuant  to  subsection  (j)  of  section three thousand four
   27  hundred twenty of the insurance law relating to every  policy  providing
   28  comprehensive  personal liability insurance on a one, two, three or four
   29  family owner-occupied dwelling. The state insurance fund  shall,  notify
   30  its insureds that such assessments, shall be, for the purpose of recoup-
   31  ment,  treated as separate costs, respectively for the purpose of premi-
   32  ums billed on or after October first, nineteen hundred ninety-four.
   33    S 2. Paragraphs (b) and (c) of subdivision 2 of  section  151  of  the
   34  workers' compensation law, paragraph (b) as amended by section 2 of part
   35  QQ  of  chapter  56  of the laws of 2009 and paragraph (c) as amended by
   36  chapter 6 of the laws of 2007, are amended to read as follows:
   37    (b) An itemized statement of the expenses so ascertained shall be open
   38  to public inspection in the office of the board for  thirty  days  after
   39  notice to the state insurance fund, all insurance carriers and all self-
   40  insurers  including  ALL  ACTIVE  group  self-insurers affected thereby,
   41  before the board shall make an assessment for such expenses.  The  chair
   42  shall  assess  upon and collect a proportion of such expenses as herein-
   43  after provided from each insurance carrier, the state insurance fund and
   44  each self-insurer including ALL ACTIVE group self-insurers. The  assess-
   45  ment  for  such  expenses shall be allocated to (i) self-insurers except
   46  group self-insurers and the state insurance fund based upon the  propor-
   47  tion  that  the  total  compensation  payments made by all self-insurers
   48  except group self-insurers and the state insurance  fund  in  such  year
   49  bore to the total compensation payments made by all self-insurers except
   50  group  self-insurers,  the  state insurance fund, all insurance carriers
   51  and ALL ACTIVE group self-insurers and  (ii)  insurance  carriers  based
   52  upon  the  proportion  that  the total compensation payments made by all
   53  insurance carriers in such year bore to the total compensation  payments
   54  by  all self-insurers, the state insurance fund and all insurance carri-
   55  ers, and (iii) ACTIVE group self-insurers based upon the proportion that
   56  the total compensation payments made by all ACTIVE  group  self-insurers

       S. 2818                             4

    1  in  such  year bore to the total compensation payments made by all self-
    2  insurers (EXCEPT INACTIVE GROUP SELF-INSURERS), the state insurance fund
    3  and all insurance carriers. The  portion  of  the  assessment  for  such
    4  expenses  allocated  to self-insurers except group self-insurers and the
    5  state insurance fund that shall  be  collected  from  each  self-insurer
    6  except  group  self-insurers and the state insurance fund shall be a sum
    7  equal to the proportion of  the  amount  which  the  total  compensation
    8  payments  of  each  such self-insurer except a group self-insurer or the
    9  state insurance fund  in  such  year  bore  to  the  total  compensation
   10  payments  made  by  all self-insurers except group self-insurers and the
   11  state insurance fund. The portion of the assessment  for  such  expenses
   12  allocated  to  insurance carriers that shall be collected from each such
   13  insurance carrier shall be a sum equal to that proportion of the  amount
   14  which  the total standard premium by each such insurance carrier bore to
   15  the total standard premium reported by all insurance  carriers  for  the
   16  calendar  year  which  ended  with the state fiscal year. The portion of
   17  such sum allocated to ACTIVE group self-insurers that shall be collected
   18  from each ACTIVE group self-insurer shall be a sum equal to that propor-
   19  tion of the amount which the pure  premium  calculation  for  each  such
   20  group  self-insurer  bore  to the total pure premium calculation for all
   21  group self-insurers for the calendar year which ended within  the  state
   22  fiscal year. The amounts so secured shall be used for the payment of the
   23  expenses  of  administering this chapter.   Pure premium for assessments
   24  against individual [and group self-insurers] who ceased  to  self-insure
   25  shall  be based on payroll at the time the individual [or group self-in-
   26  surer] has ceased to self-insure, reduced by  a  factor  reflecting  the
   27  reduction  in  the  [group  or] individual self-insurer's self-insurance
   28  liabilities since ceasing to self-insure.
   29    For purposes of this paragraph,  "standard  premium"  shall  mean  the
   30  premium  as  defined  for  the purposes of this assessment by the super-
   31  intendent of insurance, in consultation with the chair of the board  and
   32  the  workers'  compensation rating board. For purposes of this paragraph
   33  "pure premium calculation" means the New York state annual payroll as of
   34  December thirty-first of the preceding  year  by  class  code  for  each
   35  employer  member  of  [a] AN ACTIVE group self-insurer multiplied by the
   36  applicable rate for each  class  code  as  determined  by  the  workers'
   37  compensation  rating  board  in  effect  on December thirty-first of the
   38  preceding year. The amounts so secured shall be used for the payment  of
   39  the expenses of administering this chapter.
   40    For the purposes of this paragraph, the term "insurance carrier" shall
   41  include  only  stock  corporations,  mutual  corporations and reciprocal
   42  insurers authorized to transact the business  of  workers'  compensation
   43  insurance  in  this  state and the term "self-insurer" shall include any
   44  employer or group of employers permitted to  pay  compensation  directly
   45  under  the  provisions  of subdivision three, three-a or four of section
   46  fifty of this chapter.
   47    (c) Assessments for the special disability fund, the fund for reopened
   48  cases and for the operations of the board shall not constitute  elements
   49  of  loss  but shall for collection purposes be treated as separate costs
   50  by carriers. All ACTIVE group self-insurers shall collect  such  assess-
   51  ments  from  their  employer members in a fair and equitable manner. All
   52  insurance carriers, including the state insurance  fund,  shall  collect
   53  such  assessments  from their policyholders through a surcharge based on
   54  premium in accordance with rules set forth  by  the  New  York  workers'
   55  compensation  rating  board, as approved by the superintendent of insur-
   56  ance. Such surcharge shall be considered as part of premium for purposes

       S. 2818                             5

    1  prescribed by law including, but not limited to, computing premium  tax,
    2  reporting  to  the superintendent of insurance pursuant to section nine-
    3  ty-nine of this chapter and section three hundred seven of the insurance
    4  law,  determining  the limitation of expenditures for the administration
    5  of the state insurance fund pursuant to  section  eighty-eight  of  this
    6  chapter  and  the  cancellation  by  an insurance carrier, including the
    7  state insurance fund, of a policy for non-payment of premium.
    8    S 3. This act shall take effect January 1, 2012, and  shall  apply  to
    9  any assessment cycle beginning on and after such date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the workers' compensation law, in relation to active self-insurers
